Job Title: Modeling Simulations Wargaming Operator 3 (Military Operations Analyst 3) - 15901
Job Description:
Requisition Number: 15901

Required Travel: 0 - 10%

Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt

Hours Per Week: 40

Anticipated Salary Range: $71,471.00 - $100,000.00

Security Clearance: TS/SCI

Level of Experience: Mid

Summary

HII Mission Technologies is currently seeking Wargaming Modeling & Simulations Operator 3 (Military Operations Analyst 3) to come join our team supporting military operations in the beautiful Colorado Springs, CO area.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Conducts simulations, modeling, and operating Modeling and Simulations (M&S) tools for air, land, maritime, missile, space/cyberspace, logistics, and command and control domains into a Joint Live, Virtua, Constructive (LVC) environment for executing joint and combined wargames and exercises.
Familiarity with multiple modeling and simulation tools used across the DoD.
This operator role will focus on building the scripts for individual actions that are taking place during each exercise and will be operating the models, making sure the entities in each model are behaving properly throughout the games.
Attends meetings, workshops, and conferences to gather information and make M&S system recommendations necessary to support wargame and exercise events and create the associated scenario databases.
Works in conjunction with a M&S Integrator to support preparation of memoranda, technical plans, and reports to develop the synthetic environment for N&NC wargames and exercises, ensuring the M&S environment provides the capabilities to meet mission requirements for the conduct of wargame and exercise events.
Assesses representation in the virtual environment and provides recommendations for improvement and additional realism. Applies analytical techniques in the evaluation of models and simulations.
Support/planning for 1-2 large wargames and 2 Tier-1 exercises
May require travel




Minimum Qualifications

5 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; 3 years relevant experience with Masters in related field; 0 years experience with PhD or Juris Doctorate in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 9 years relevant experience.

Must have a minimum of five (5) years of joint Modeling & Simulation (M&S) planning experience in a Combat Support Agency, Combatant Command, or Joint Staff level.
Must have practical experience in the application of M&S tools for the planning and execution of joint wargames and/or exercises.
Individual should be able to understand and apply joint doctrine.
Intermediate knowledge of M&S architectures and design methodology for experiments using live, virtual, and constructive (LVC) environments.
Comprehensive knowledge of a broad range of modeling, simulation, and analysis techniques.
Familiarity with the operation of a broad range of M&S tools during exercise and wargame execution.
Operational expertise or related experience supporting air, land, and/or maritime operations.

TS/SCI Clearance required

#LI-RM1

Physical Requirements

May require working in an office, industrial, shipboard, or laboratory environment. Capable of climbing ladders and tolerating confined spaces and extreme temperature variances.

HII's Mission Technologies division develops integrated solutions that enable today's connected, all-domain force. Capabilities include C5ISR systems and operations; the application of AI and machine learning to battlefield decisions; defensive and offensive cyberspace strategies and EW; unmanned, autonomous systems; LVC solutions; platform modernization; and critical nuclear operations. Together, HII's domain expertise and advanced technologies support mission partners anywhere around the globe. For more information, visit tsd.huntingtoningalls.com.

HII is a global engineering and defense technologies provider. With a 135-year history of trusted partnerships in advancing U.S. national security, HII delivers critical capabilities ranging from the most powerful and survivable naval ships ever built, to unmanned systems, ISR and AI/ML analytics. HII leads the industry in mission-driven solutions that support and enable a networked, all-domain force. Headquartered in Virginia, HII's skilled workforce is 44,000 strong.

Working at HII is more than a job - it's an opportunity to build a new future. We offer competitive benefits such as best-in-class medical, dental and vision plan choices; onsite health, vision and dental at some locations; wellness resources; employee assistance programs; Savings Plan Options (401(k)); financial planning tools, life insurance; employee discounts; paid holidays and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; as well as early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships.

HII is committed to cultivating an inclusive company culture to promote collaboration and enhance creativity by hiring a diverse work force. HII is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

Our pharmacy benefit management (PBM) offering represents an important growth area for Rightway. Helping clients better manage pharmacy spend to make drugs more affordable for their employees and dependents is critical to their business sustainability. Rightway is responsible for designing, building, and operating a new-to-the-world PBM model base on our core tenets: fairness & transparency, unlocking the supply chain, supporting the physician-patient relationship, and utilizing navigation to empower consumers

The PBM Operations Analyst is a member of the Rightway Operations team reporting to the Director, Claims & Data Operations. This role will be responsible for the configuration, testing and maintenance of benefits, and related claims adjudication rules within the claim platform along with ongoing management of data operations.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Support the execution of all eligibility and accumulator operations and interfaces from implementation through ongoing operations and maintenance.
Serve as day-to-day contact for all eligibility and accumulator needs.
Collaborates with technology, account management, benefit administration, and other internal stakeholders to ensure that eligibility and accumulator functions are implemented and operating in accordance with requirements.
Oversee all downstream vendor feeds (i.e. ID card fulfillment), third party integrations (i.e. health plans, TPAs) and ensures all deliverables are met timely and troubleshoots issues.
Configures benefits into the claim adjudication platform, including benefit inclusions/exclusions copay, accumulator, and other benefit parameters.
Develops and executes on test scenarios to ensure accuracy of benefit setup both at initial setup and conducts ongoing monitoring and regression testing. Works to correct all identified defects.
Performs research and troubleshoots inquiries or issues related to claims adjudication, accumulators, and eligibility.
Ensures all documentation regarding setup and internal controls is always up to date.

WHO YOU ARE:

Bachelor's degree preferred. Relevant experience considered for exceptional candidates.
Pharmacy Technician or related experience highly desirable
1-3 years of PBM experience in claims or benefit configuration

SALARY RANGE :

$60,000-$80,000
CYBERSECURITY AWARENESS NOTICE:

In response to ongoing and industry-wide fraudulent recruitment activities (i.e., job scams), Rightway wants to inform potential candidates that we will only contact them from the @rightwayhealthcare.com email domain. We will never ask for bank details or deposits of any kind as a condition of employment. If you have any questions about a suspicious interaction with Rightway, please feel free to reach out to us at hr@rightwayhealthcare.com.

ABOUT RIGHTWAY

Rightway is on a mission to harmonize healthcare for everyone, everywhere. Our products guide patients to the best care and medications by inserting clinicians and pharmacists into a patient's care journey through a modern, mobile app. Rightway is a front door to healthcare, giving patients the tools they need along with on-demand access to Rightway health guides, human experts that answer their questions and manage the frustrating parts of healthcare for them. Since its founding in 2017, Rightway has raised over $130mm from investors including Khosla Ventures, Thrive Capital, and Tiger Global at a valuation of $1 billion. We're headquartered in New York City, with a satellite office in Denver. Our clients rely on us to transform the healthcare experience, improve outcomes for their teams, and decrease their healthcare costs.

HOW WE LIVE OUR VALUES TO OUR TEAMMATES:

We're seeking those with passion for healthcare and relentless devotion to our goal. We need team members that embody our following core values:

1) We are human, first
Our humanity binds us together. We bring the same empathetic approach to every individual we engage with, whether it be our members, our clients, or each other. We are all worthy of respect and understanding and we engage in our interactions with care and intention. We honor our stories. We listen to—and hear—each other, we celebrate our differences and similarities, we are present for each other, and we strive for mutual understanding.

2) We redefine what is possible
We always look beyond the obstacles in front of us to imagine new solutions. We approach our work with inspiration from other industries, other leaders, and other challenges. We use ingenuity and resourcefulness when faced with tough problems.

3) We debate then commit
We believe that a spirit of open discourse is part of a healthy culture. We understand and appreciate different perspectives and we challenge our assumptions. When working toward a decision or a new solution, we actively listen to one another, approach it with a "yes, and" mentality, and assume positive intent. Once a decision is made, we align and champion it as one team.

4) We cultivate grit
Changing healthcare doesn't happen overnight. We reflect and learn from challenges and approach the future with a determination to strive for better. In the face of daunting situations, we value persistence. We embrace failure as a stepping stone to future success. On this journey, we seek to act with guts, resilience, initiative, and tenacity.

5) We seek to delight
Healthcare is complicated and personal. We work tirelessly to meet the goals of our clients while also delivering the best experience to our members. We recognize that no matter the role or team, we each play a crucial part in our members' care and take that responsibility seriously. When faced with an obstacle, we are kind, respectful, and solution-oriented in our approach. We hold ourselves accountable to our clients and our members' success.




Rightway is a healthcare company looking to improve healthcare outcomes for everyone, everywhere. With that in mind, we have to consider what is good for the health of our team, the company, and the communities we operate in. As such, Rightway has determined a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees, in combination with other safety precautions, is the best way forward.

Rightway is PROUDLY an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes in strength in the diversity of thought processes, beliefs, background and education and fosters an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated to drive the best business decisions possible. We do not discriminate on any basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the consideration of merit, qualifications, need and performance.

Job Title: Account Manager – Atalan: Access to Access Lab Network
Job Description:
ABOUT

HealthEco is an investment and strategic advisory firm partnered with leading US health systems to produce effective growth strategies that scale across the healthcare ecosystem. Our team operates in a fast-paced environment partnering with the nation’s top health system executives to build, commercialize, and invest in businesses that deliver tangible financial impact. We act as an extension of their team providing market analysis and critical insights throughout the portfolio lifecycle, including but not limited to deal sourcing and evaluation, management team recruiting, and commercial launch programming.

HealthEco has assembled a system of innovative, forward-thinking, like-minded clinical labs led by some of the most advanced academic medical centers in the country with the aim to commercialize a new portfolio company called Atalan - Access to Access Lab Network. Atalan is a tech-enabled partnership that brings high-end esoteric laboratories into a single network. Atalan provides doctors, clinics, and regional hospitals access to the best laboratory diagnostics in the country, providing patients with access to the best laboratory medicine, ultimately driving better health outcomes for patients.

ROLE

The Account Manager – Atalan role is based out of our Denver, CO office and is a critical position for the HealthEco Growth team. As an Account Manager, you will provide education; effectively promote products through a consultative-based selling approach; interface with individuals and departments to meet Client needs; be responsible for the care and growth of new clients and grow account sales; demonstrate both the ability to listen well and to assist internal and external clients; project an upbeat and positive attitude; exercise sound judgment; compliantly take initiative and be flexible; and creatively solve problems to maintain and grow relationships.

We seek an experienced and resourceful self-starter who enjoys working in team-based environments and can also thrive with significant autonomy. They exhibit a confident, humble attitude complimented by high personal energy, and will enjoy our flexible, entrepreneurial culture while resiliently taking on challenges proactively.

A successful candidate is accountable, values results, and quickly establishes and builds long-term relationships and credibility with key stakeholders. They actively streamline the preparation of content including client and prospect communications, meeting preparation and follow-up, and process documentation across company platforms. The team member also manages the development of relationships to identify opportunities within designated target accounts and ventures. They are also eager to learn, create, collaborate, and innovate in a fast-paced environment.

Joining our team will allow you to shape the future of the healthcare landscape on a national scale while working alongside a close community of clinical innovators, and healthcare leaders providing the platform to:

Grow and expand your professional experience with a national network of healthcare systems.
Gain exposure to help drive long-term strategic investments and venture creation
Experience a collaborative, respectful, and exciting team culture with a shared vision for driving impact in healthcare.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Account Manager will work with us to support client growth strategies, meet growth goals, and develop market intelligence for the advancement of client engagement and customer activities. They actively develop and support tasks related to the customer journey process ensuring consistency in communication and relationship management.

This role requires strong organizational skills, a high level of professionalism and confidentiality, excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to anticipate needs, work independently and prioritize workload.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients to ensure their satisfaction and maximize retention.
Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, addressing inquiries, providing guidance, and offering solutions to their needs.
Develop a deep understanding of clients' businesses, industries, and challenges to effectively position and promote relevant Atalan services.
Identify opportunities for growth for additional services to existing clients, aiming to increase volume, revenue and account growth.
Collaborate with internal teams, such as sales, marketing, and customer support, to coordinate efforts and ensure a seamless client experience.
Monitor key performance indicators and metrics to assess client satisfaction, identify areas for improvement, and take proactive steps to address any concerns.
Prepare and deliver regular reports and presentations to clients and Atalan management highlighting account performance, key insights, and recommendations for optimization.
Stay updated on industry trends, competitive landscape, and market dynamics to provide strategic guidance and insights to clients.
Understand contracts, pricing, and terms with clients, ensuring mutual agreement and adherence to company policies and guidelines.
Participate in business development activities to expand the client base and generate new leads.
Resolve all issues associated with pricing, invoices, or other administrative problems.
Set appointments with appropriate personnel to present and sell Atalan technology in the account to grow the utilization of services and test volume.
Develop a business plan for the account and incorporate it into our Quarterly Business Review process.
Work with Regional Clients to present the Business Reviews in a way that is mutually beneficial.
Provide strong management of all aspects of the business.
Meet or exceed Performance metrics.
Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree required (preferably in Business or related fields). Knowledge of health systems and experience working with large healthcare provider organizations or corporations is a plus, but not required.
Understanding of the clinical laboratory industry, including equipment, reagents, and services. Familiarity with scientific research and laboratory protocols is a significant advantage.
Proven experience developing and implementing business analysis and materials in support of company objectives.
Product knowledge demonstrated through proficient handling of the company’s core story, features, benefits, and objections
Demonstrate sales competencies which include demonstrating determination, being a self-starter and handling stress; being an excellent prospector, an outstanding closer, passionate about learning, possessing the power of persuasion and demonstrating effective time management skills
Proficient in video conferencing/webinar systems and other virtual meeting applications.
Experience and regular interaction with CRM software; Salesforce.com experience preferred.
Skilled with digital productivity tools including Microsoft (i.e., Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.) and Google Workspace toolsets (i.e., Google Sheets, Docs, Slides, etc.), and other computer facilities
Demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Outstanding organization and time management skills with attention to detail.
Comfort working in a rapidly evolving, entrepreneurial environment and dealing with ambiguity while executing tasks and meeting deadlines.
Superb problem-solving skills and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong decision-making skills, including knowing when to ask for help and continuing to move forward when wrong.
A team player who takes pride in team success.
Be comfortable and excited to work ~90% of the time regionally for standard business needs and as backup support 10% in Denver

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:

Availability to travel to events or meetings as needed
Must be able to travel by automobile (valid driver's license required), public transit or ground transportation, and commercial airlines

HealthEco is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, veteran or military status, unfavorable military discharge, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Bowhead seeks a Military Operations Analyst to support the CoE Space and Missile Defense contract in Colorado Springs, CO.


Bowhead instructors and analysts to the United States Army Space and Missile Defense Command, Space and Missile Defense (SMD) Center of Excellence (SMDCoE), US SMD School. SMD School core functions include: 1) Educate, train, and develop leaders for Space and Missile Defense operations; 2) Develop Army Doctrine for Space, High Altitude, and Global Missile Defense; 3) Develop individual and collective training tasks for space and missile defense operations; and 4) Execute the Army Quality Assurance Program to ensure standards are met in the educations, training, and leadership development of Soldiers and Civilians.

Experience with Ground Based Mid-Course Defense and Missile Defense
Understanding of Space Fundamentals
Understanding Army and Joint staffing processes
Ability to coordinate and engage with external higher Federal and Government Agency
Experience and understanding of military operations
Excellent written and oral communication skills

Previous instructor-facilitator experience

Ability to articulate space non-space personnel

DESIRED

MOSQ: FA40, Space 200, ASCBC, Space Operations Course, GMD or other relevant space courses
Graduate of a military instructor training course (ITC/SGITC, FIFC, ABIC, AFBIC, etc.)
Sensor Manager Qualification Course (SMQC), or Sensor Leadership Development Course (SMLDC)

Target Salary: $85,000-$90,000 commensurate with experience

SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIRED: Must be able obtain and maintain security clearance at the Top Secret level. Candidates with a Top Secret/SCI are highly preferred. US Citizenship is a requirement for holding a clearance at this location.

HII's Mission Technologies division develops integrated solutions that enable today's connected, all-domain force. Capabilities include C5ISR systems and operations; the application of AI and machine learning to battlefield decisions; defensive and offensive cyberspace strategies and EW; unmanned, autonomous systems; LVC solutions; platform modernization; and critical nuclear operations. HII is a global engineering and defense technologies provider. With a 135-year history of trusted partnerships in advancing U.S. national security, HII delivers critical capabilities ranging from the most powerful and survivable naval ships ever built, to unmanned systems, ISR and AI/ML analytics. HII leads the industry in mission-driven solutions that support and enable a networked, all-domain force. Headquartered in Virginia, HII's skilled workforce is 44,000 strong.

Job Description:

The Power Platform Functional Consultant will harness their skills as a business analyst and passion to improve government for everyday citizens to develop technology solutions that automate previously manual processes. The Consultant will be part of a cross-functional team of Crowe and government resources working towards a common goal of using digital innovation and automation to solve real-world business challenges.

The Power Platform Functional Consultant will harness their skills as a business analyst and passion to improve government for everyday citizens to develop technology solutions that automate previously manual processes. The Consultant will be part of a cross-functional team of Crowe and government resources working towards a common goal of using digital innovation and automation to solve real-world business challenges.


The Power Platform Functional Consultant will perform the following responsibilities:


Gathering business requirements through one-on-one interviews and group workshops.

Documenting requirements through the creation of business process models, user stories, product backlog items, and use cases.

Configuring Microsoft Power Platform functionality to implement business-driven forms, entities, view, relationship, and site maps.

Creating Microsoft Power Automate flows to manage business rules and workflow.

Clearly communicating with developers the customer’s business needs.

Performing system testing, logging defects, and performing root-cause analysis.

Writing test scripts to support User Acceptance Testing.

Transferring knowledge to customer end users through formal and informal training.

Submitting accurate and timely submissions of project status and time.


Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree required.

Minimum 2 years of business analysis experience in software development.

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and/or Power Platform preferred.

Knowledge of internetworking technology.

Strong writing and interpersonal communication skills.

The ability to handle multiple projects concurrently.

Ability to work on Pacific Time.


Additional Skills Desired:

Microsoft Power Platform certifications

Experience creating dashboard and reports using Power BI

Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States.
